description.narrative: Australia has a long-standing relationship with UNAIDS, a multilateral organisation and body of the United Nations (UN). Its mission is to lead, strengthen and support an expanded response to HIV and AIDS that includes preventing transmission of HIV, providing care and support to people living with HIV, reducing the vulnerability of individuals and communities to HIV testing and alleviating the impact of the epidemic. 2. Australia works with UNAIDS because it is closely aligned with, and furthers, Australia’s interests and priorities in health and development. Its technical guidance in the specialised area of HIV prevention and AIDS treatment, and its engagement with civil society and key affected populations is critical for leveraging maximum impact from other investments in global health, including our investment in the Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria. The total vale of this investment is $22.5 million over 4 years, starting in 2017-18.
